document.heading: Evictions with Dignity Amendment Act of 2008

history.narrative: Law 17-146, the “Evictions with Dignity Amendment Act of 2008”, was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 17-61 which was referred to the Committee on Housing and Urban Affairs. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on January 8, 2008, and February 5, 2008, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on February 25, 2008, it was assigned Act No. 17-312 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 17-146 became effective on April 15, 2008.
